bio: Chef Chan Yan-tak learning the art of Traditional Chinese Cuisine in 1987, when he was just 18 years old. He underwent systematic training in Shanghai to master many skills, such as knife work, selecting ingredients, seasoning, and temperature control. After many years of hard work, he developed a thorough understanding of Chinese Cuisine’s various styles.

recipe.name: Beef Roast
steps: Place beef roast in crock pot.
Mix the dried mixes together in a bowl and sprinkle over the roast.
Pour the water around the roast.
Cook on low for 7-9 hours.

recipe.name: Chicken Curry
steps: Place chicken in crock pot.
Mix the dried mixes together in a bowl and sprinkle over the roast.
Pour the water around the roast.
Cook on low for 7-9 hours.

recipe.name: Mutton Curry
steps: Place Mutton in crock pot.
Mix the dried mixes together in a bowl and sprinkle over the roast.
Pour the water around the roast.
Cook on low for 7-9 hours.
